alert.note: Alert for Kern (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 20 at 2:28PM PDT until August 20 at 5:15PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hanford has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Kern County in central California... * Until 515 PM PDT. * At 228 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cameron and Mojave. This includes the following streams and drainages... Oak Creek and Cache Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
